block.p: Valerie Ann Fanning and William Bruce Aitchison were married yesterday afternoon at their house in Portland, Ore., by Associate Justice Robert D. Durham of the Oregon Supreme Court.
The couple are lawyers in Portland. The bride is a family-law associate at Gevurtz, Menashe, Larson & Howe, and the bridegroom, a labor lawyer, is a founding partner of Aitchison & Vick.
Valerie Ann Fanning and William Bruce Aitchison were married yesterday afternoon at their house in Portland, Ore., by Associate Justice Robert D. Durham of the Oregon Supreme Court.
The couple are lawyers in Portland. The bride is a family-law associate at Gevurtz, Menashe, Larson & Howe, and the bridegroom, a labor lawyer, is a founding partner of Aitchison & Vick.
Ms. Fanning, 35, who is keeping her name, is also a director of the Oregon American Civil Liberties Union. She graduated from Boston College and the Lewis and Clark Northwestern School of Law.

She is a daughter of Anne Reiniger and a stepdaughter of Douglas Reiniger of Brooklyn. Her mother is executive director of the New York Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Children and a chairwoman of the New York City chapter of Parental Education and Custody Effectiveness, which helps divorcing parents and their children. The bride's stepfather is a family-law and adoption lawyer and a founding partner in Rosin & Reiniger, a Manhattan law firm. She is also the daughter of Donald Fanning of Sands Point, N.Y.

Mr. Aitchison, 49, also owns Labor Relations Information Systems, a Portland company that conducts monthly seminars and publishes books and newsletters. He graduated from the Robert Donald Clark Honors College of the University of Oregon and received a law degree from Georgetown University. He is a son of the late Ruth Helen Essary and the late Clyde Bruce Aitchison Jr., a lawyer in Encino, Calif.
The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.
